EMEA Purchasing - logistics & packaging Internship,"Supply Chain Planner te Den Haag

Ben jij op zoek naar een uitdagende en afwisselende functie binnen een mooi familiebedrijf? Wil jij ons helpen stappen te maken op het gebied van Supply Chain, operational én digital excellence? Lees dan zeker verder!
Wat doe je als Supply Chain Planner?

Ben jij de schakel tussen abstracte data en de uitdagingen van de dagelijkse praktijk? Wil jij de essentiële brugfunctie vervullen tussen inkoop, logistiek, magazijn en commercie? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

Als Supply Chain Planner lever je niet alleen een technische, maar ook een administratieve én commerciële bijdrage aan het gezamenlijke teamresultaat. Je zorgt voor de verwerking en controle van gegevens in het ERP- systeem, waaronder het verwerken en controleren van inkoopcontracten, inkooporders, inkoopdocumenten en magazijnontvangsten. Ook werk je mee aan het (aan)vullen van product specificaties in ons Product Informatie Management systeem.
Jouw taken:

Je biedt technische ondersteuning aan het algemene inkoopproces, je begeleidt het logistieke proces, controleert de Interne Kwaliteitsbewaking (IKB) en dient als back-up voor het verzorgen van technische tekeningen
Je levert een bijdrage aan het artikelbeheer en je maakt diverse calculaties
Je beheert voorraden, signaleert tijdig manco’s en bent proactief in het voorkomen van problemen
Je stuurt onze productie aan voor diverse productgroepen
Je levert een bijdrage aan onze uitdagende en complexe logistiek
Je helpt met het onderhouden van producten, aanvullen van productkenmerken en de bijbehorende classificaties binnen het ERP en het PIM systeem.
Gezocht profiel:

Je beschikt over een afgeronde opleiding richting Economie, Business, ICT Management, Supply Chain en/of je hebt relevante werkervaring op administratief en/of Supply Chain gebied. Beschik je nog niet over de relevante werkervaring? Dan staat er een team van professionals voor je klaar die je graag verder helpt
Je hebt minimaal een MBO+/HBO denkniveau
Je bent analytisch, nauwkeurig, proactief en communicatief sterk
Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, Duitse en Engelse taal is een pre
Je hebt kennis en ervaring met technieken in Excel en gaat secuur te werk
Je hebt ervaring met ERP systemen, Microsoft Navision/Business Central is een pre
Ervaring met Autocad is een pre
En je hebt natuurlijk humor en houdt van gezelligheid
Wij bieden jou:
Een startsalaris vanaf €3.367,89 op basis van een 40 uur per week
Een leuk, professioneel en ambitieus team met veel enthousiasme en behulpzaamheid
Ruimte voor ontwikkeling d.m.v. interne en externe trainingen behorend bij de functie
Laptop en mobiele telefoon
Reiskostenvergoeding van € 0,21 ct. km.
Je komt in aanmerking voor een aantrekkelijke tantième regeling en niet-ziek bonus
Deelname aan pensioenregeling (Bpf Meubel) op basis van een 50/50 premieverdeling
Werken in een professioneel en ambitieus team met een informele werksfeer
Een prachtig familiebedrijf met diverse bedrijfsuitjes per jaar en gezellige borrels!
Mogelijkheid tot het volgen van aanvullende trainingen en opleidingen
Over Dekker Hout

Dekker Hout is een familiebedrijf dat in 1885 is begonnen als lokale houthandel en is uitgegroeid tot één van de meest vooruitstrevende houtbedrijven in Europa. Wij zijn gespecialiseerd in de import, export en verwerking van hout, houtproducten en gerelateerde materialen. Het hout dat wij inkopen wordt door onafhankelijke organisaties gecontroleerd en gecertificeerd en is afkomstig uit bossen die op duurzame wijze worden beheerd. Omdat kwaliteit, levertijd en leverbetrouwbaarheid bij ons voorop staan, investeren wij continue in onze logistieke en productie organisatie. Daarbij leiden wij onze medewerkers op zodat iedereen een bijdrage kan leveren aan het optimaliseren van onze dienstverlening aan onze klanten en het vergroten van ons bedrijfsresultaat. Bij Dekker Hout werken dan ook vakmensen met kennis van zaken die samen met onze klanten dagelijks aan de weg timmeren. We zijn ambitieus en gedreven vanuit de overtuiging dat onze organisatie naast een rijke historie ook een mooie toekomst heeft in een sector waar duurzaamheid een gewoonte wordt!

Heb jij interesse in deze uitdagende functie met daarin een belangrijke rol in de doorontwikkeling van de organisatie en haar medewerkers? Stuur dan je motivatiebrief en CV. Within this traineeship, you will receive the opportunity to experience what it means to control our production planning, to work with suppliers and customers, to manage escalations, to optimize current processes, collaborate with colleagues, and so on. Within a period of 2,5 years, you will experience 3 different functions which will contribute to a successful reaction to our ever-growing customer demand.

Personal development is key. This traineeship will challenge you to practice and evolve your skillset with regard to problem-solving, communication, flexibility and pro-activity. Next to that, we will provide the opportunity to support you in the development of hard skills that are necessary to grow within your profession. You will be guided by the manager of your function plus a coach who can support you during this traineeship. The goal of this traineeship is to become a supply chain specialist with an extensive background in multiple roles.
Whether you’re interested in logistics, procurement or operations, this traineeship will provide you with valuable skills that will set you apart in the workforce.

column1: Tactical supply chain planner,"CEVA Logistics provides global supply chain solutions to connect people, products and providers all around the world. We are supply chain experts. We live and breathe logistics every day. Above all, we believe that this is a people business. That’s why we are building a global culture of teamwork and respect. We encourage initiative, and we engage and empower our diverse workforce to grow their careers within CEVA.

CEVA Logistics offers a broad range of end-to-end, customized solutions in both Contract Logistics and Freight Management thanks to our approximately 98,000 employees at more than 1,000 facilities in 160 countries worldwide. With the recent acquisition of the former Ingram Micro Commerce & Lifecycle Services business, we are building one of the world’s leading end-to-end eCommerce service offerings through the dedication and passion of our people—the heartbeat of our organization. As we continue growing at a fast pace, will you “Dare to Grow” with us?

Are you looking for a job in Inventory Control were you can coordinate the team? Do you want to use your analytical skills for process improvements? And would you like to have a job with career opportunities towards Engineering or other departments? Then this job is something for you!
THE ROL

As Logistics Inventory Analyst you will ensure that our stock management is set up as efficiently and properly as possible! LEAN is our philosophy, in which you will analyze how the processes within stock management can be further improved. You are an advisor AND assistant to your manager when it comes to the way we manage our stock. You manage the stock counts carried out by your colleagues and you investigate deviations. From your analyses, you come up with a solution that ensures that the deviations no longer occur and that CEVA organizes its stock even more efficiently. In this way you contribute to our logistics services towards our customers. In addition, this role is a great and educational position to get known with CEVA and broaden your experience in process improvements!

Your are going to work in Eindhoven with 5-10 colleagues. An important requirement is that you can make jokes, because they will be made many times in our team! The rest of the time, we work hard to make sure our customers are satisfied. The options for working from home can be discussed in consultation with the Inventory Supervisor, to whom you report. Working hours vary between 08:00 and 18:00.
WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO?
As Logistics Inventory Analyst you are going to:
Manage, monitor and analyze the inventory towards our customers
Analyze the current processes of our inventory management and describe them towards improvements
Preparing stock counts and analyze them
Investigate issues and problems in our inventory management and create solutions fort hem
Report about the stock counts and deviations towards your supervisor and customers
Participating at improvement projects.
WHAT DO YOU NEED FOR THIS JOB?
Do you recognize yourself in the following knowledge and skills:
Bachelor’s degree, preferring Logistics Management or Engineering
Analytical skills and pro active attitude
Communication skills
Excel skills and knowledge
Good English writing and speaking skills
WHAT DO WE OFFER?

At CEVA Logistics there are plenty of opportunities to get the best out of yourself and your career. Besides a dynamic environment in which we achieve our goals at a rapid pace and in a result-oriented manner, we offer a position with room for fun and connection. This role can be the first step in a broad career path within our organization. The possibilities to walk your own path are endless!
In addition, we offer:
A competitive gross salary between € 2,227 and € 3,153 depending on your work experience and level of education
An annual contract with a view to permanent employment
25 vacation days + 40 ADV hours (only with a fulltime employment) and the option to buy or sell extra leave
Profit share of max. 3% in case of positive company results
Good pension scheme, travel allowance and 8% holiday pay
Opportunity to participate to our CEVAfit program
The possibility to develop yourself by means of our CEVA Academy.
INTERESTED?

Then just send your resume and letter (optional) to Remco Hendrikx, Corporate Recruiter, via remco.hendrikx@cevalogistics.com or press on apply. You can also reach out via phone: +31 (0)6 83 22 25 39.

column1: Junior Supply Chain Analyst,"Tactical supply chain planner
(Fulltime, 38 hours per week)

Do you want to join a new international team and are you keen to participate in project that will improve our processes? Then you could be our new Tactical Supply Chain Planner in our Head Office in North-Holland. You will work on our huge logistics challenge of keeping more than 11 million customers happy every week by offering over 6,000 products at the lowest prices in more than 2,000 stores around Europe. At the same time, the number of our stores and distribution centres continues to grow.
This is your daily action

You will act as our senior expert at the heart of our supply chain operation. As a Tactical Supply Chain Planner, you will enable fellow planners to do their jobs in the best possible way. By anticipating and translating future aspects and capacities into planning parameters and a flow of goods strategy, you’re able to plan up to 2 years ahead. You will work closely with the operational supply planners and your colleagues in Capacity, Commerce and Controlling.
As a Tactical Supply Chain Planner :
Drive the optimization of the Action’s supply chain network by setting up a replenishment parameter structure with the goal of optimal utilization of the Network at the lowest cost.
You’re responsible for the replenishment parameters of all inbound flows from Asia and Europe, their optimization and coordination with the operational Supply Planners
You facilitate a continuous improvement process a.o. by setting up a new BI landscape and further developing data driven process decisions.
You act as the go-to person for complex network issues, facilitate and drive discussions and follow-up with internal and external stakeholders in this.

You anticipate internal and external effects affecting the supply chain such as Chinese New Year, commercial seasons, supply chain disruptions, etc. and translate these to the impact on the network through simulations and recurring patterns.
You work on developing Supplier Level Agreements (SLA) regarding delivery performance, reliability, availability, OTIF, etc. and their follow-up.
You participate in and lead improvement projects to make the chain more scalable and manageable such as DC/HUB expansion, Dual sourcing and CFS.
You work closely with both our commercial and logistics departments and suppliers to optimize performance and processes.
Meet your team

High-level planning is achieved with our 70-strong Supply Chain Planning team. With a global scope, a highly dynamic product range and a growing number of distribution centres, stores, hubs and cross-docks, you will face exciting challenges day in, day out. A sense of resilience is needed to deal with these challenges, and that's why we invest heavily in developing innovative tools as well as in everyone who works at Action through extensive training programmes and more. We offer a vibrant work environment that will help you to take the next step. Many colleagues have already led the way and will be happy to guide you through our unique team and our varied work.
This is you

If you see that something could be done more efficient or more effectively, you'll be itching to get started! You also gain energy from structuring and improving processes. Others describe you as organised, flexible and someone who can go the extra mile. You'll also find that teamwork makes the dream work, as the saying goes, which is why you enjoy working with colleagues. You're also able to put your strong communication skills to good use to build a constructive relationship with your stakeholders and incorporate them into your plans.
What else:
You have a bachelor or master degree, preferably in Supply Chain
At least 8 years of experience in Supply Chain Management, for example as a planner or analyst in an (international) retail company
You have an analytical mindset and an expert in Excel
You have experience in project management
Good level of English
How we contribute to society

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you join us. For example, we are working hard behind the scenes to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,000 children worldwide who are growing up in an SOS Children’s Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 124 nationalities? That we already source 70% of our wood products and 86% of our cotton sustainably? And that only energy-efficient LED lighting is used in more than half of our stores? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we’re facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself.
